member.name: T:Catfood.Shapefile.Shape
member.summary: Base Shapefile shape - contains only the shape type and metadata plus helper methods. An instance of Shape is the Null ShapeType. If the Type field is not ShapeType.Null then cast to the more specific shape (i.e. ShapePolygon).

member.name: M:Catfood.Shapefile.Shape.#ctor(Catfood.Shapefile.ShapeType,System.Int32,System.Collections.Specialized.StringDictionary)
member.summary: Base Shapefile shape - contains only the shape type and metadata plus helper methods. An instance of Shape is the Null ShapeType. If the Type field is not ShapeType.Null then cast to the more specific shape (i.e. ShapePolygon).
member.param: The record number in the Shapefile

member.name: M:Catfood.Shapefile.Shape.GetMetadata(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the metadata (as a string) for a given name (key). Valid names for this shape can be retrieved by calling GetMetadataNames().
member.returns: The metadata string, or null if the requested name does not exist

member.name: M:Catfood.Shapefile.Shape.GetMetadataNames
member.summary: Gets an array of valid metadata names (keys) for this shape. Returns null if not metadata exists.
member.returns: Array of metadata names, or null of no metadata exists

member.name: M:Catfood.Shapefile.Shape.ParseBoundingBox(System.Byte[],System.Int32,Catfood.Shapefile.ProvidedOrder)
member.summary: Extracts a double precision rectangle (RectangleD) from a byte array - assumes that the called has validated that there is enough space in the byte array for four doubles (32 bytes)
member.param: byte order of the doubles to be extracted

member.name: M:Catfood.Shapefile.Shape.ParsePolyLineOrPolygon(System.Byte[],Catfood.Shapefile.RectangleD@,System.Collections.Generic.List{Catfood.Shapefile.PointD[]}@)
member.summary: The PolyLine and Polygon shapes share the same structure, this method parses the bounding box and list of parts for both
member.param: The shape record as a byte array

member.name: T:Catfood.Shapefile.Shapefile
member.summary: Provides a readonly IEnumerable interface to an ERSI Shapefile. NOTE - has not been designed to be thread safe
member.remarks: See the ESRI Shapefile specification at http://www.esri.com/library/whitepapers/pdfs/shapefile.pdf

member.name: M:Catfood.Shapefile.Shapefile.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new Shapefile object.

member.name: M:Catfood.Shapefile.Shapefile.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new Shapefile object and open a Shapefile. Note that three files are required - the main file (.shp), the index file (.shx) and the dBASE table (.dbf). The three files must all have the same filename (i.e. shapes.shp, shapes.shx and shapes.dbf). Set path to any one of these three files to open the Shapefile.
member.param: Path to the .shp, .shx or .dbf file for this Shapefile
member.exception: Thrown if the Shapefile has been disposed
Thrown if the path parameter is null
Thrown if the path parameter is empty
Thrown if one of the three required files is not found

member.name: M:Catfood.Shapefile.Shapefile.Open(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new Shapefile object and open a Shapefile. Note that three files are required - the main file (.shp), the index file (.shx) and the dBASE table (.dbf). The three files must all have the same filename (i.e. shapes.shp, shapes.shx and shapes.dbf). Set path to any one of these three files to open the Shapefile.
member.param: Path to the .shp, .shx or .dbf file for this Shapefile
member.exception: Thrown if the Shapefile has been disposed
Thrown if the path parameter is null
Thrown if the path parameter is empty
Thrown if one of the three required files is not found
Thrown if an error occurs parsing file headers

member.name: M:Catfood.Shapefile.Shapefile.Close
member.summary: Close the Shapefile. Equivalent to calling Dispose().

member.name: M:Catfood.Shapefile.Shapefile.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the Shapefile and free all resources.

member.name: M:Catfood.Shapefile.Shapefile.MoveNext
member.summary: Move to the next item in the collection (returns false if at the end)
member.returns: false if there are no more items in the collection

member.name: M:Catfood.Shapefile.Shapefile.Reset
member.summary: Reset the enumerator

member.summary: Get the IEnumerator for this Shapefile

member.summary: Gets the number of shapes in the Shapefile

member.summary: Gets the bounding box for the Shapefile

member.name: P:Catfood.Shapefile.Shapefile.Type
member.summary: Gets the ShapeType of the Shapefile

member.name: P:Catfood.Shapefile.Shapefile.Current
member.summary: Gets the current shape in the collection

member.name: P:Catfood.Shapefile.Shapefile.System#Collections#IEnumerator#Current
member.summary: Gets the current item in the collection

Thrown if shapeData is less than 12 bytes long

member.name: T:Catfood.Shapefile.ProvidedOrder
member.summary: The order of bytes provided to EndianBitConverter

member.name: F:Catfood.Shapefile.ProvidedOrder.Big
member.summary: Value is stored as big-endian

member.name: F:Catfood.Shapefile.ProvidedOrder.Little
member.summary: Value is stored as little-endian

member.name: T:Catfood.Shapefile.EndianBitConverter
member.summary: BitConverter methods that allow a different source byte order (only a subset of BitConverter)

member.name: M:Catfood.Shapefile.EndianBitConverter.ToInt32(System.Byte[],System.Int32,Catfood.Shapefile.ProvidedOrder)
member.summary: Returns an integer from four bytes of a byte array
member.exception: Thrown if value is null
Thrown if startIndex is invalid

member.name: M:Catfood.Shapefile.EndianBitConverter.ToDouble(System.Byte[],System.Int32,Catfood.Shapefile.ProvidedOrder)
member.summary: Returns a double from eight bytes of a byte array
member.exception: Thrown if value is null
Thrown if startIndex is invalid
